page.title: 20TRANSPORT
page.content:
SOMERSHAM SITS ASTRIDE THE B1050 AND B1086 WHICH JOIN CHATTERIS TO ST. IVES AND HUNTINGDON, AND BEING ON A CLASS B NETWORK, ROAD LINKS ARE NOT GOOD. TRAFFIC PROBLEMS INCLUDE POOR VISIBILITY AT A NUMBER OF ROAD JUNCTIONS AND INSUFFICIENT OFF-STREET PARKING IN SOMERSHAM, A MATTER DUE TO BE RESOLVED BY A NEW VILLAGE CAR PARK. SOMERSHAM'S RURAL LOCATION MAKES IT DIFFICULT TO SERVE ECONOMICALLY BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT. BUSES DO RUN TO ST. IVES, HUNTINGDON, CHATTERIS AND CAMBRIDGE BUT ROUTES ARE TORTUOUS SO AS TO COVER AN ECONOMIC CATCHMENT AREA AND JOURNEYS ARE CORRESPONDINGLY LONG. A LOCAL COACH COMPANY RUN A WEEKLY SHOPPING TRIP TO A LOCAL HYPERMARKET.
COMPILED BY J3 AND J4 CHILDREN AND TEACHERS AT SOMERSHAM C.P. SCHOOL DURING THE SUMMER TERM OF 1985.
